com.mindalliance.configuration

Class ElementController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mindalliance.configuration.ElementController

  • public class ElementController
extends java.lang.Object
    The ElementController class contains the methods to find element on Web page and wait until the element is not found.
    Author:
    AFourTech

      • findElementSmart

        public boolean findElementSmart(java.lang.String fileName,
                       java.lang.String elementName,
                       java.util.ArrayList<?> findBys)
                         throws UIAutomationException
        Checks whether an element is present on a particular page as defined in the in ObjectRepository. This method is primarily used to check for a page element and return a boolean value which is passed to the assertion for a particular page.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The XML file to be read
        elementName - GivenName in the XML file
        findBys - ArrayList for smart search
        Returns:
        true if element with 'elementName' found else returns false.
        Throws:
        UIAutomationException

      • visibilityOfElementLocated

        public static org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedCondition<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> visibilityOfElementLocated(org.openqa.selenium.By locator,
                                                                                                          int pageNo)
        Waits for a particular element to be visible/enable
        Parameters:
        locator - Element to search for visibility
        pageNo - Page number to search for visibility
        Returns:
        Object of WebElement if it is enabled else throws ElementNotVisibleException exception

      • searchListFromTables

        public boolean searchListFromTables(java.lang.String fileName,
                           java.lang.String givenName,
                           java.lang.String elementName,
                           java.lang.String notFound)
                             throws UIAutomationException
        Searches an element with 'elementName' in the application
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of xml file from which to search an element
        givenName - The GivenName in xml file
        elementName - The name of the element to be searched
        notFound - The name of the element which is not found
        Returns:
        true if element with 'elementName' present in the application else return false
        Throws:
        UIAutomationException

      • requireElementSmart

        public void requireElementSmart(java.lang.String fileName,
                       java.lang.String elementName,
                       java.util.ArrayList<?> findBys,
                       java.lang.String notFound)
                         throws UIAutomationException
        Finds an expected element on a page as defined in the in ObjectRepository and throws an exception if the element is not found. This method is called when we are expecting a certain element and we want to perform an operation on that element.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The xml file to be read
        elementName - GivenName in the xml file
        findBys - ArrayList for smart search
        notFound - The name of the element which is not found
        Throws:
        UIAutomationException

      • findElementBy

        public void findElementBy(java.lang.String findBy,
                 java.lang.String value,
                 java.lang.String elementName)
                   throws UIAutomationException
        Finds element on a page by passing parameters ( xpath / id ) and corresponding value
        Parameters:
        findBy - id / xpath / linktext / partiallinktext / name
        value - Value of id / xpath / linktext / partiallinktext / name
        elementName - Name of element to be searched for
        Throws:
        UIAutomationException
